p: To the Sheriff of King County, Greeting:

In the name of the United States of America you are hereby commanded to take the body of James Riley , "if to be found in your county" and him safely keep, so that you have him before the District Court for Pierce County W. T. at a time to be lugin and holden at Stalacono in said County and Territory on the 21st day of September A D 1863, "the same being the third Monday in said month" then and there to answer on an indictment pending against him for Malicious Mahem.
Hearing Jail not and have you then and there this writ with your doings endorsed thereon.
Witness the Hon C.C. Hewetts Chief Justice of Washington Territory and presiding Judge of the District Court for Pierce County W.T. this 24th day of August AD 1863.
